channel.title: Will it be the same?
channel.description:
Will it?
We will never have the excitements of the old school good updates, wondering what will come next. The community is not the same. We have experienced it all already. Will it feel the same experiencing it again?
I'm not talking about those hours or days of wonder when you first start the game, I mean the feeling of accomplishment as you strive to better your account. Completing quests. Leveling up. Making money.
What are your goals? Why will you be playing? I'm sure some of you know, but I don't. I played back in the day for the community, paying for two memberships so that I could use my brothers old account to advertise my level 70 construction house parties, where people had fun interacting and exploring the funny bugs and glitches. Will this still exist? Or have the minds of those that continued playing already been broken? I'm sure some of you know that house parties are all but extinct in the modern day RS... some would blame distractions with other content. I blame the shrinking player base and the new highly competitive nature of the community (aside from PKing, of course). How popular will this version be? I think as some people realize this is not what they imagined (not saying a majority or anything though), it will start to slow down as well.
I can assure you it will not be the same. I'm depressed. Knowing that what I want is impossible. But then I realize... we can make the most of it. I realize... I know some parts of the game will still be fun! I can train my Magic, it's my favorite skill besides Construction, and then use it in Castle wars! I can relive my quests, knowing it wont be the same as doing them the first time, but I can laugh at how incompetent I was when doing underground pass with less than 30 agility.
It will not be the same, but we can make the most of it. And through it all, I think the most important part is not what Jagex decides to do, it's what we do to make it fun.

item.title: Will it be the same?

item.title: Will it be the same?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Lavadm, post:25, topic:490535”]Jagex mod said Old school server will MAY have 2x-3x EXP accelerated rates.

[Quote=Jagex Mod]
Hi everyone - we wanted to get your thoughts on something…

We’ve noticed that some players love the idea of starting fresh character in Old School RuneScape, but some others have said they don’t like the idea of having to spend time re-levelling to where they are in the main game.

Importing your current avatar won’t be possible, but what do you think about accelerated XP gain? Theoretically this could provide a fresh start but hasten the progress to higher levels. Is this a great solution or is it blasphemy to the authenticity of Old School servers?

Please let us know what you think
[/Quote][/quote]
It was suggested but it was also got a majorly negative response from the community. TBH I wouldn’t play at all if it was anything other than normal rs2007, that’s what we’ve been asking for, that’s what we want, if players wanted custom things they’d play a private server.

Read full topic

@classic wrote:

Just saying, they didn’t say double or anything just accelerated, also its not going to happen, they only wanted our opinion on what it would be like if we did do that

Jagex Mod:

Hi everyone - we wanted to get your thoughts on something…

We’ve noticed that some players love the idea of starting fresh character in Old School RuneScape, but some others have said they don’t like the idea of having to spend time re-levelling to where they are in the main game.

Importing your current avatar won’t be possible, but what do you think about accelerated XP gain? Theoretically this could provide a fresh start but hasten the progress to higher levels. Is this a great solution or is it blasphemy to the authenticity of Old School servers?

Please let us know what you think

casey.:

The community for the most part will still be shit imo. However, the grind, challenge, and bits of nostalgia will make it fun.

Agree 100%, except the fact that you can’t replace that learning curve. You already know how and where to do everything. But the community is always going to stay as it is until some form if real life change occurs. I blame shitty parents and lack of control and manners taught to children.

Read full topic

item.title: Will it be the same?
item.dc:creator: @Lavadm Lavadm
item.description:
@Lavadm wrote:

People will bot, just like they did in the Remake RSPS’s. A lot of people are clouded by nostalgic feelings but the server will have lots of people for the first few months then start to die down. It’s very hard for a game to have 0 content updates and be playable for years. People forget that updates back then were exciting and yes they were bad for the long run as many people quit. But i don’t really thing they quit because of the content updates, but because they had to grow up and have an actual life. College and Jobs are what killed runescape. As you see many people currently playing RSPS’s are people who were 7-8 years old during 2006-2007 and barely knew how the game worked back then, and with that the older community left and the newer, younger community continued but there was no growth. So the community kept dying off until where we got today.

The oldschool server will last a few months imo before it becomes the same as the current community. It’s not that great as people are making it out to be. With no content people will blow through it and start gambling and botting because that’s all there is left to do.

This was already tested. Just look at current remake RSPS’s. People loved them for the 1st few months but then came the botters, gambling crowd, glitchers, and “trolls”. It wrecked the scene and all thats left is the current crowd.

Read full topic

item.title: Will it be the same?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

As cool and fun as RS07 was, I think RSPS drained the last of my strive for it, especially PRS06. Despite how accurate Rune Rebels is, I can’t play it for more than 5 minutes without being bored out of my mind. Plus with all the knowledge of the 2007 client and how the game works now, bots will roll around like they are nothing and the entire game will be ruined.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

It wont be the same. I grew up with the game, it changing just as I would. Reverting back would never be the same as that feeling of awe and wonder you get when your first starting. I’ll play a few days for nostalgia, then afterwards I’ll just play the live game never looking back.

Read full topic

item.title: Will it be the same?
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

It will NEVER be the same.

The community back then was so helpful and nice, everyone helped people out and chatted. Made friends easily.

Now, the community is shit. Kids spam, annoy, bot, and just piss people off on purpose.

It won’t be as exciting because you’ve already played it, played a newer version and going back to it. The funner thing about 2007 was everyone was younger and it was more exciting.

Read full topic
